dt: {bc}to turn over at length in the mind {bc}{sx|ponder||}
{bc}to cause to go round in an orbit
{bc}to move in a curved path round a center or axis
{bc}to turn or roll round on an axis
{bc}to have or come to a specified focus {bc}{sx|center||}

et: Middle English {it}revolven{/it} "to pass (of time), wind round, roll," borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}revolver{/it} "to turn, turn over (in the mind)," borrowed from Latin {it}revolvere{/it} "to roll back to a starting point, bring back round, (passive) travel in a circular course, return to a starting point," from {it}re-{/it} {et_link|re-|re-} + {it}volvere{/it} "to set in a circular course, cause to roll, bring round" {ma}{mat|wallow:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to turn over at length in the mind : ponder
to cause to go round in an orbit

meta.id: someone's world revolves around (someone or something)
stems: someone's world revolves around (someone or something)

hwi.hw: someone's world revolves around (someone or something)

dt: used to say that someone or something is extremely important in a person's life

shortdef: —used to say that someone or something is extremely important in a person's life

dt: {bc}someone's life, problems, etc., are more important than other people's

dt.t: I can't just drop everything to help you. {it}The world{/it} doesn't {it}revolve around{/it} you, you know.

shortdef: someone's life, problems, etc., are more important than other people's

dt: {bc}to move around (something) in a path that is similar to a circle
{bc}to have (someone or something) as a main subject or interest

dt.t: The discussion {it}revolved around{/it} the question of repairing the roads.
He thinks {phrase}the world revolves around{/phrase} him.

shortdef: to move around (something) in a path that is similar to a circle
to have (someone or something) as a main subject or interest
